identificationModule.briefTitle: Identification of Genomic Predictors of Adverse Events After Cardiac Surgery
identificationModule.officialTitle: Identification of Genomic Predictors of Adverse Events After Cardiac Surgery

collaborators.name: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)
University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
This study aims to identify genetic causes of adverse events after cardiac surgery, such as atrial fibrillation, myocardial infarction, renal dysfunction and heart failure.

Patients undergoing heart surgery at Brigham and Women's Hospital and Texas Heart Institute are eligible to participate.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: This study aims to identify genetic causes of adverse events after cardiac surgery, such as atrial fibrillation, myocardial infarction, renal dysfunction and heart failure. In addition, we also examine blood and urine biomarkers (proteins).

bioSpec.description: DNA, buffy coat, plasma, serum and urine

primaryOutcomes.measure: Mortality (i.e. number of participants who are deceased during postoperative day 0 up to year 5)
primaryOutcomes.description: Data will be collected from electronic medical records; data points to be collected for this measurement include serum creatinine.

otherOutcomes.measure: Acute Kidney Injury using KDIGO criteria: albumin/creatinine ratio (>/= 300 mg/g) and eGRF (< 60 mL/min/1.73^2)
otherOutcomes.description: Data will be collected from electronic medical records; data points to be collected for this measurement include serum creatinine.
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Day of procedure to post procedure day 7

otherOutcomes.measure: Presence of Arrhythmia (i.e. number of patients who develop an arrhythmia after their cardiac surgery)
otherOutcomes.description: Data will be collected from electronic medical records; data points to be collected for this measurement include post-procedural EKG reports and progress notes.

otherOutcomes.measure: Myocardial Infarction (i.e. number of participants who develop a MI during postoperative day 0 to year 5)
otherOutcomes.description: Data will be collected from electronic medical records; data points to be collected for this measurement include post-procedural EKG reports, cardiac enzyme values, progress notes, and cardiac catheterization reports.

otherOutcomes.measure: Heart failure per NYHA class II, III, IV
otherOutcomes.description: This will be measured in accordance to New York Heart Association Guidelines.

otherOutcomes.measure: Quality of Life Survey - The Kansas City Cardiomyopathy Questionnaire (KCCQShortForm)
otherOutcomes.description: A questionnaire to assess for heart failure
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Administered once prior to the procedure and 1 month to 5 years after hospital discharge

otherOutcomes.measure: Quality of Life Survey - The Seattle Angina Questionnaire (SAQShortForm)
otherOutcomes.description: A questionnaire to assess for angina
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Administered once prior to the procedure and 1 month to 5 years after hospital discharge

otherOutcomes.measure: Quality of Life Survey - 12-item short form health survey (SF12)
otherOutcomes.description: A questionnaire to assess for overall health
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: Administered once prior to the procedure and 1 month to 5 years after hospital discharge

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Undergoing heart surgery
* Willing to provide consent

Exclusion Criteria:

* Enrolled in a concurrent drug or device trial that precludes concurrent enrollment

overallOfficials.name: Jochen D Muehlschlegel, MD MMSc, MPH

locations.facility: Department Texas Heart Institute at St. Luke's Episcopal Hospital
